Plot Networks

There are different ways to plot grids listed below:

Network Representation

plotting.plot_networks.plot_contextily(plz: str, kcid: int, bcid: int, zoomfactor: int = 19) → None

plots a network with all its features (cables, houses and load, trafo) on a contextily basemap

Parameters:

  • plz (string) – PLZ of grid

  • kcid (int) – kmeans cluster id of grid

  • bcid (int) – buildings cluster id of grid

  • zoomfactor (int) – zoom factor for basemap, defaults to 17

If the contextily basemap cannot be loaded, change the zoomfactor.

plotting.plot_networks.plot_simple_grid(plz: str, kcid: int, bcid: int) → None

plots network on a plank base

plotting.plot_networks.plot_grid_on_map(plz: str, kcid: int, bcid: int) → None

plots network on a basemap provided by plotly

Tree Graph Representation

plotting.plot_networks.plot_with_generic_coordinates(plz: str, kcid: int, bcid: int) → None
plotting.plot_networks.draw_tree_network(G, width=1.0)

draws a tree graph of a networkx graph with specific node colors: orange: transformers, blue: connection nodes green: consumers

plotting.plot_networks.draw_tree_network_improved_spacing(G)

draws a tree graph of a networkx graph with improved spacing for large networks with specific node colors: orange: transformers, blue: connection nodes green: consumers

plotting.plot_networks.draw_radial_network(G)

draws a radial graph of a networkx graph with specific node colors: orange: transformers, blue: connection nodes green: consumers
